list-item.p: Bacterial sulfate reducers release sulfur compounds with intermediate oxidation state, which are then further metabolized to zero-valent sulfur,
Bacterial sulfate reduction ceases to metabolize acetate, which enables yet uncultivated microorganisms to establish a sulfur cycle that produces zero-valent sulfur,

Methanogens – potentially in syntrophic partnership with other organisms – couple methylotrophic methane production or carbon dioxide and acetate reduction to the oxidation of sulfide to zero-valent sulfur,
